    • Method Detail

      • removeStartStr

        public static java.lang.String removeStartStr(java.lang.String toRemove,
                                              java.lang.String str,
                                              boolean isCaseSensitive)
        Returns a new String resulting from removing toRemove from the start of the String str.
        Returns the original String, if toRemove is not found at the start of str.

        Example: removeStartStr("abc", "abcdefg", false) returns "defg".
        Parameters:
        toRemove - a String of characters that we want to remove from the start of str.
        str - a String.
        isCaseSensitive - if set to true, will only remove from the start of the string if there is a case-sensitive match,
        if false will use a case-insensitive match.
        Returns:
        a new String resulting from removing toRemove from the start of the String str.
        Returns the original String, if toRemove is not found at the start of str.

      • removeStartChar

        public static java.lang.String removeStartChar(char c,
                                               java.lang.String s)
        Returns a new String resulting from removing the character c from the start of the String s.
        Returns the original String, if the character c is not found at the start of s.

        Example: removeStartChar('a', "abc") returns "bc".
        Parameters:
        c - a character to remove from the start of String s.
        s - a String.
        Returns:
        a new String resulting from removing the character c from the start of the String s.
        Returns the original String, if the character c is not found at the start of s.

      • removeEndChar

        public static java.lang.String removeEndChar(char c,
                                             java.lang.String s)
        Returns a new String resulting from removing the character c from the end of the String s.
        Returns the original String, if the character c is not found at the end of s.

        Example: removeEndChar('c', "abc") returns "ab".
        Parameters:
        c - a character to remove from the end of String s.
        s - a String.
        Returns:
        a new String resulting from removing the character c from the end of the String s.
        Returns the original String, if the character c is not found at the end of s.

      • removeSquareBloc

        public static java.lang.String removeSquareBloc(java.lang.String s)
        Returns a new String resulting from removing anything between the first occurence of an open bracket [ and a closing bracket ] found inside the String s.

        Example: removeSquareBloc("Mary [had a little]lamb") returns "Mary lamb"
        Parameters:
        s - a String.
        Returns:
        a new String resulting from removing anything between the first occurence of an open bracket and a closing bracket [.....] found inside the String s.
